reasonCode.text: Diffuse abdominal pain for two days

note.text: Causing a small bowel obstruction due to an enterolith impacted in the distal ileum and an isolated jejunal diverticulitis with incidental Meckel’s diverticulum.
The enterolith was manually and proximally retrogradely pushed. The inflamed jejunal diverticulum was surgically resected along with the Meckel’s diverticulum.

resource.conclusion: Diffuse fluid distention of the small bowel loops indicative of obstruction. A profusion of dilated small bowel diverticula along the mesenteric border. An isolated jejunal diverticulitis in the right flank. A 3 cm large enterolith impacted in the distal ileum causing small bowel obstruction. Incidentally discovered Meckel’s diverticulum.

resource.title: Discharge Instructions
resource.description: The patient should follow a healthy diet plan to manage diabetes and excess weight. Follow-up appointments were scheduled to ensure timely evaluation and improvement of the patient's condition.
